name: eidetic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An eidetic memory is the ability to remember things in exact detail, as if you can see them in your mind: He was a brilliant student with an eidetic memory. Compare
photographic memory
An eidetic image is one you see in great detail in your mind: Of all the eidetic images that remain from my childhood, this is the most vivid.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has an eidetic memory so that, if, as he's going onstage, someone tells him there's a table of firemen to his left, he can mentally flick through his files for the section of firemen jokes .She was filing it away in her eidetic memory to bring up at another time in the future.Some hackers report experiencing strong eidetic imagery when in cyberspace. Do you first need to form a picture of the two of us sitting in that café discussing your father- an eidetic image- before the words come to you?
